description: Concerning county public works reporting requirements.

status.text: First reading, referred to Local Government.

original.text:
H-0260.3
HOUSE BILL 1145
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByRepresentative Barkis
Prefiled 12/31/24.Read first time 01/13/25.Referred to Committee on Local Government.
AN ACT Relating to county public works reporting requirements; and adding a new section to chapter 36.01 RCW.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 1. A new section is added to chapter 36.01 RCW to read as follows:
(1)(a) Counties must collect and retain records of any public works activity that it undertakes.
(b) At a minimum, the records of public works activity must include:
(i) If more than a de minimis amount of soil, trees, shrubs, gravel, or other natural or organic material that was present prior to the public works activity was removed during the activity, the amount of such material that was removed;
(ii) Where the removed materials were taken and how they were disposed of;
(iii) Whether any of the removed materials were reused for other projects; and
(iv) Whether the materials were tested for contaminants and the results of any such tests.
(2) For the purposes of this section:
(a) "De minimis amount" means an amount of natural or organic material removed that would be too small to be reasonably noticed by the naked eye without a detailed examination of the area.
(b) "Public works activity" means any maintenance or construction activity that is undertaken by the county on a county road as defined in chapter 46.04 RCW that is on or adjacent to property owned by another.
--- END ---

summary.text:
Purpose

The purpose of House Bill 1145 is to establish new reporting requirements for counties regarding public works activities. This bill aims to enhance accountability and transparency by mandating counties to collect and maintain detailed records of public works activities, especially regarding the removal of natural materials. The key change from prior regulations is the introduction of specific data points that counties must document, thereby impacting how such activities are reported and monitored.

Key Provisions

Record Keeping Requirements

  • Counties must collect and keep records for any public works activity they undertake.
  • The records must include at minimum:
    • The amount of soil, trees, shrubs, gravel, or other natural or organic materials removed if more than a de minimis amount.
    • Details on where the removed materials were taken and how they were disposed of.
    • Information on whether any of the removed materials were reused for other projects.
    • Results from any tests performed on the materials for contaminants.

Definitions for Clarity

  • "De minimis amount" is defined as a quantity of natural or organic material that is too small to be easily noticed without detailed examination.
  • "Public works activity" refers to any maintenance or construction activities conducted by the county on a county road that is on or near privately owned property.
